meanings.definition: To disengage the clutch of a vehicle.
meanings.sent1: He declutched the car before shifting gears.
meanings.sent2: The driver declutched smoothly to avoid stalling.
meanings.sent3: The car declutched itself when the engine stalled.
meanings.sent4: She felt like she had declutched from the chaos of the city.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic showed him how to declutch the manual transmission.

meanings.definition: To remove unnecessary items or clutter from a space.
meanings.sent1: She declutched her closet by donating old clothes.
meanings.sent2: The professional organizer declutched the messy room in no time.
meanings.sent3: After declutching the kitchen, it felt more spacious and organized.
meanings.sent4: Her mind felt declutched after a relaxing weekend getaway.
meanings.sent5: Declutching the living room made it feel more inviting and cozy.
